compounddef.title: Brushless Motor Control Real-Time CAN API

detaileddescription.para: This package provides a real-time API for communication with the motor control board and the OptoForce sensor via CAN.
A description of the CAN protocol that is implemented by this library can be found on Confluence: https://atlas.is.localnet/confluence/display/AMDW/BLMC+-+CAN+Interface
This package contains a executable blmc_can_demo, that shows how to use the library.
Supports (tested) Ubuntu patched with RT-preempt. Supports (experimental) Mac OS , Ubuntu patched with Xenomai

A real-time CAN driver has to be loaded and the interface to be set up. This can be done with the script start_rtcan that is included in the xenomai-core repository (https://git-amd.tuebingen.mpg.de/amd-clmc/xenomai-core).
Note that the board has to run a program that implements the same CAN protocol. At the time of writing this README, this is only the case for dual_motor_torque_ctrl.
The code is well documented with Doxygen comments. To generate a HTML documentation, build with catkin_make install -DBUILD_DOCUMENTATION=ON
